page.title: 02Fishing in Pevensey Bay.
page.content: Mr Gell,a{fisherman}lives in a cottage on the beach at Pevensey Bay.He and his wife have a{small shop}selling fish and seafood.Weather permitting he fishes daily starting between three and six in the morning.His boat,the Lady Margaret is built of African Mahogany.He has been fishing for thirty two years since he was a boy. He catches most of his own fish but sometimes goes to{Hastings fishmarket at half past five in the morning,to supplement his catch.His boat was built in 1976 and has a net hauler and echo sounder.Pots catch crab and lobster.Fish are caught in nets,the positions shown by buoys and land markers.A good catch is ten to fifteen lobsters.Once he caught a thirteen pound lobster,and a ninety pound monkfish.Winter catch is cod and herring,with plaice and sole in summer
